com.unvired.ump.agent

Interface IJDBCRequest

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IUMPRequest, java.io.Serializable

    public interface IJDBCRequest
extends IUMPRequest
    The interface IJDBCRequest provides an abstraction to submit JDBC requests to an underlying RDBMS 
      Sample code for inserting a product record - PRODUCT(ID,DESCRIPTION,PRICE)
  The sample assumes that the proxy classes for the required tables are generated using the Unvired eclipse-plugin.
   
  public void execute(IBusinessProcess process)
  {
                //Proxy class for the PRODUCT table generated using the eclipse plugin
                PRODUCT product = new PRODUCT();
                product.setID(new Integer(123));
                product.setDESCRIPTION("ACME product");
                product.setPRICE(new BigDecimal(199.99));

                IJDBCRequest jdbcRequest = (IJDBCRequest)process.createRequestObject(RequestType.JDBC);

                //Set the request type 
                jdbcRequest.setRequestType(JDBCRequest.InsUpdDel);

                //Set the operation type
                jdbcRequest.setRecord(JDBCOperation.Insert, product);

                IJDBCResponse jdbcResponse = process.getService().submitJDBCRequest(jdbcRequest, "COMPANY_NAMESPACE", "FUNCTION_NAME");
  }

    • Method Detail

      • setRequestType

        void setRequestType(IJDBCRequest.Mode mode)
        Sets the JDBC request type. A request can be a simple query, an insert/udpate/delete operation, stored procedure call or a batch execution
        Parameters:
        mode - - Enumeration of type IJDBCRequest.Mode

      • setRow

        void setRow(IJDBCRequest.Operation dbOperation,
            Row row)
        Sets the database row and the operation to be performed on that row.
        Parameters:
        dbOperation - - Enumeration of type IJDBCRequest.Operation
        row - - Row object corresponding to a row in the RDBMS table

      • addRowToBatch

        void addRowToBatch(IJDBCRequest.Operation dbOperation,
                   Row row)
        This function is used to execute more that one database operation in a single transaction. The process agent can use this function to create a batch request with more than one database row and execute all the operations in once transaction.
        Even if one operation fails the entire transaction is rolled back
        Parameters:
        dbOperation - - Enumeration of type IJDBCRequest.Operation
        row - the row

      • setProcedure

        void setProcedure(Procedure storedProcedure)
        Sets the stored procedure to be executed in the RDBMS. Proxies for stored procedures are generated using the Unvired eclipse plugin.
        Parameters:
        storedProcedure - - Procedure object corresponding to a stored procedure

      • setQuery

        void setQuery(Row row,
              java.util.List<java.lang.String> columns,
              ConditionClause conditionClause)
        Sets the SELECT query to be executed in the RDBMS.
        Parameters:
        row - - Row object corresponding to a row in the RDBMS table
        columns - - List of columns to fetch from the RDBMS table
        conditionClause - - (@link ConditionClause} containing the selection criteria

      • setQuery

        void setQuery(Row row,
              java.util.List<java.lang.String> columns,
              ConditionClause conditionClause,
              int limit,
              int offset)
        Sets the SELECT query to be executed in the RDBMS.
        Parameters:
        row - - Row object corresponding to a row in the RDBMS table
        columns - - List of columns to fetch from the RDBMS table
        conditionClause - - (@link ConditionClause} containing the selection criteria
        limit - - Maximum number of rows to return from the server
        offset - - Offset from where to return the data in the result set
